title: In chapter 7, how do I list child support I pay? I put it in the budget. Do I also list on Sched E as priority debt? Not behind.
question: I pay a given amount monthly...actually, they take it from my check. I don't think there is really a balance; just a recurring charge. Also, I am trying to figure out whether to call myself a household of 2 (including my daughter). She is with me part time.
answers:
You might be able to claim a household of two if she lives with you part time and you support her. However, if the part time is small (less than 50%) or very small (less than 25%), then you might have a problem justifying the claim.

As for child support, though it does not get listed on Schedule E if you are not behind, it does get reported to the trustee who must notify the recipient of the bankruptcy. The 2005 changes to the law place this burden on the trustee. Some attorneys just put it on Schedule E so that the trustee has the information.

[This communication is intended as general information and not specific legal advice, and this communication does not create an attorney-client relationship.]

The monthly expense of the child support gets listed on Schedule "J" and in the appropriate place on Form 22A (in a chapter 7 case). If you don't owe any past due support, it does not get listed on Schedule "E".
